thread.title: NBA trade rumors: Pistons put Andre Drummond, Reggie Jackson on block
thread.title_full: NBA trade rumors: Pistons put Andre Drummond, Reggie Jackson on block

author: Jordan Heck (jordan.heck@performgroup.com)
title: NBA trade rumors: Pistons put Andre Drummond, Reggie Jackson on block
text:
February 15, 2017 11:28am EST February 15, 2017 11:28am EST Basketball, NBA, News, Detroit Pistons, English, Reggie Jackson, Andre Drummond The Detroit Pistons have reportedly put two big names on the trading block. Andre Drummond and Reggie Jackson (Getty Images) 
Updated at 11:28 a.m. ET 
Updated at 11:28 a.m. ET 
The Pistons have put Andre Drummond and Reggie Jackson on the trading block, according to ESPN's Zach Lowe . 
Detroit has quietly explored the trade market for each of its franchise centerpieces, according to sources across the league, and come away disappointed with the potential return. 
Drummond, 23, would be a surprising move considering his presence around the rim. He's second in the league in rebounds per game (13.9) and is fifth in total double doubles this season (37). Plus, his young age makes him a valuable asset moving forward. 
MORE: Chris Childs: I could have knocked Kobe Bryant out 
As Lowe explains, however, Drummond isn't becoming what the Pistons want from him. He says the big man "doesn't try hard enough" in many games, especially on defense. Coach Stan Van Gundy spoke with Lowe and even admitted Drummond√Ç "needs to be pushed really hard." 
Lowe doesn't expect a deal to be made for Drummond considering the lack of need for a player like him. Jackson, on the other hand, could potentially find another home. 
Detroit acquired Jackson in 2015 in a trade with the Thunder. He appeared to be developing into a solid player, averaging 18.8 points and 6.2 assists in his first season with the Pistons. But his performance has fallen this season, and it's why Detroit is looking to sell. 
Not only is Jackson not playing as well, but backup Ish Smith has looked good when he comes into the game. The offense flows better with him, so it makes sense for Detroit to move on from Jackson. But then the question becomes, what can they get in return? 
According to Lowe, not much, but the Pistons would "settle for a lower return" on the guard. 
Detroit is currently clinging on to a playoff spot, so if a deal does get made, it would for sure shake up the postseason picture. Watch This
